entry.title: What is Amazon affiliate program? Can it replace adsence for websites?
entry.content:
Hello friends I'm your friend Kavy rastogi I will tell you about the Amazon. I'm affiliate program.

In this program u can become a affiliate that means u can create links of products, if a user will buy anything from that link you will get a Commission of upto 12%( it depends on the product type)  You can link your bank account and then u can transfer your money to your bank account or either u can buy other products by the money u earned.
Can it replace Google Adsence?
Actually it cannot replace adsence because u can ads on your website/webpage but you will not receive a commission until a user buys a product but on adsence a we can earn money just when a user see / click an ad displayed.
But if your website is for comparing 2 phones or other gadgets the phone link you can provide from Amazon affiliate link and if users buy from there you will earn much more money than adsence.

entry.title: Top 5 smartphones of 2018 under Rs. 10,000: From Realme 2, Redmi Y2, Honor 7C, and more
entry.content:
The year has almost come to an end so, we have vetted out a list of top 5 smartphones of 2018 that are available in under Rs. 10,000 to give you a quick wrap of the smartphones available in this segment.Smartphones are no more a luxury product, it has become an essential need of our lives and therefore, smartphone makers are trying to design products to cater to the needs of its vast users. So, if you are looking to buy a smartphone with decent features without investing more than Rs. 10,000 then, here is a list of top 5 phones all available under your budget via online and offline stores.all the phones are very good and cannot be compared for a single purpose. 

Top 5 smartphones of 2018 under Rs. 10,000

  1.  Realme 2: The dual-sim smartphone was launched in August with a launch price of Rs. 7,500. The smartphone comes with a 6.20-inch display and a diamond-cut design. It is powered by Snapdragon 450 Octa-core processor and a 4230mAh battery. Realme 2 sports dual-rear camera setup with 13+2-megapixel and an 8-megapixel front camera. The handset is available in two variants- 3GB+32GB internal storage and 4GB+64GB storage, both expandable up to 256GB storage. The phone comes in three vibrant colours- Diamond Black, Diamond Blue and Diamond Red. 2.this is a very good phone 
  2. .Xiaomi Redmi Y2: Xiaomi Redmi Y2 comes with a 5.99-inch display and 2GHz octa-core processor. The phone packs a 3080mAh non-removable battery and provides two variants- 3GB RAM + 32GB and 4GB + 64GB internal storage. Users can lock their smartphone with the rear fingerprint scanner. The phone mounts 12+5 megapixel dual rear camera and 16-megapixel front camera. Xiaomi Redmi Y2 was launched in June with a launch price of Rs. 8,999 in three different colours- Dark Grey, Gold and Rose gold.
3. Infinix Note 5: The handset comes with a 5.99-inch display and 2GHz octa-core processor. It packs a 4500mAh battery. The smartphone provides two variants- 3GB RAM + 32GB and 4GB RAM + 64GB internal storage. It mounts a 12-megapixel rear camera and 8-megapixel LED front flash camera. Infinix Note 5 was launched in August with a launch price of Rs. 8,999 in three shades- Ice Blue, Milan Black and Berlin Gray..
4. Honor 7C: Huawei Honor 7C was launched in March with a launch price of Rs. 8,499 in blue, black and gold shades. The smartphone comes with 5.99-inch screen display and 1.8GHz octa-core processor. It is powered by 3000mAh battery. Honor 7C provides two variants- 3GB RAM + 32GB and 4GB + 64GB internal storage. The phone offers a dual-rear camera setup featuring a 13+2-megapixel rear camera and 8-megapixel front LED flash camera.
5.Moto E5: Moto E5 was launched in April 2018 with a launch price of Rs. 7,552. The smartphone features a 5.70-inch display with 1.4GHz quad-core processor. It is powered by 4000mAh non-removable battery. Moto E5 offers a 2GB RAM + 16GB internal storage. It mounts a 13-megapixel LED rear flash camera and a 5-megapixel front flash camera.

link.title: Top 5 smartphones of 2018 under Rs. 10,000: From Realme 2, Redmi Y2, Honor 7C, and more

Global announced the Nokia 8.1 in Dubai last week and the company is now all set to bring the new affordable premium smartphone to India. The company is scheduled to hold an event in the country later today to announce a new Nokia smartphone and it is largely expected to be the Nokia 8.1. The phone will replace the Nokia 7 Plus in the country as it highlights a premium design, PureDisplay screen and a new Snapdragon 710 chipset.
The Nokia 8.1 has an Average Retail Price of 399 euros (approx Rs 31,900). In India, however, we expect HMD to launch the device at a more aggressive pricing to take on the competition. The Nokia 8.1 price in India is expected to fall somewhere in between Rs 25,000 to Rs 30,000. To recall, the Nokia 7 Plus was launched in India at Rs 25,999.

Nokia 8.1 specifications

The Nokia 8.1 is a dual-SIM smartphone that offers a premium all-glass design. Much like the Nokia 5.1 Plus, the Nokia 8.1 also offers a wide notch and a chin. The front and back of the device gets a glass protection. The phone's frame is a Series 6000 aluminium with dual-tone diamond cut edges. The Nokia 8.1 is expected to be offered in three colours - Blue/Silver, Steel/Copper, Iron/Steel.
The Nokia 8.1 sports a 6.18-inch display with a FHD+ (2246x1080) resolution and 18.7:9 aspect ratio. It also gets the PureDisplay screen technology that was first introduced with the Nokia 7.1. PureDisplay essentially means to offer higher contrast (1:1500) and a sharper display along with HDR10 support. The LCD panel also offers brightness up to 500 nits.
Powering the Nokia 8.1 is a 2.2GHz octa-core Snapdragon 710 chipset coupled with 4GB of RAM. It is offered with 64GB of inbuilt storage with support for storage expandability up to 400GB via microSD card. As of now, we are not sure if HMD will offer another storage and memory variant of the Nokia 8.1. The Nokia 8.1 packs a 3,500mAh battery with 18W fast charging support and a promise of two-day battery life. The Nokia 8.1 is an Android One device much like every other Nokia phone this year and this one ships with Android 9 Pie out-of-the-box.
The Nokia 8.1 get Zeiss-powered cameras. The rear camera system includes a 12MP + 13MP configuration. The primary sensor gets a 1.4 micron pixel, OIS, EIS and 2PD support. The secondary sensor will offer depth sensing. It also comes with a 20MP front-facing camera. The Nokia 8.1 supports connectivity options like Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth 5.0, GPS/ AGPS + GLONASS. The handset measures 154.8x75.76x7.97mm and weighs 178

link.title: Nokia 8.1 specs, price and launch date
